channel.title: Comments on: Gu Li vs Lee Sedol – Jubango Game 5 Amateur Review

item.title: By: LV426

item.description: Move 180 comment: "White descends solidly to prevent Black from getting the sente endgame play. (To see what I mean, go back to Move 179 and click D13." It is D12. (Hawkeye ;) and thanks for the answer about games 6,7,8. We're waiting for it! Good luck!
item.content:encoded:
Move 180 comment:
“White
descends solidly to prevent Black from getting the sente endgame play.
(To see what I mean, go back to Move 179 and click D13.”
It is D12.
(Hawkeye ðŸ˜‰
and thanks for the answer about games 6,7,8. We’re waiting for it!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Excellent question! I do plan on finishing this series, but it probably won't be until November. Thanks for the encouragement!
item.content:encoded: Excellent question! I do plan on finishing this series, but it probably won’t be until November. Thanks for the encouragement!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Thought there is a lot of aji on top, I would have to say that I personally feel like the center required attention at the time and he would have had to have faith in himself to fight it out on the top. But then again, they were probably having a tough time dealing with the altitude on top of the intense match. So I'm in no place to judge. Haha.
item.content:encoded:
Thought there is a lot of aji on top, I would have to say that I personally feel like the center required attention at the time and he would have had to have faith in himself to fight it out on the top.
But then again, they were probably having a tough time dealing with the altitude on top of the intense match. So I’m in no place to judge. Haha.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I would agree with Arthur that your theory sounds pretty plausible. They were both fighting with altitude sickness. And according to GoGameGuru, Gu Li was more affected by it than Lee Sedol. So that may have something to do with it as well.
item.content:encoded: I would agree with Arthur that your theory sounds pretty plausible. They were both fighting with altitude sickness. And according to GoGameGuru, Gu Li was more affected by it than Lee Sedol. So that may have something to do with it as well.

item.title: By: RisingStar
item.dc:creator: RisingStar
item.description: Guess we'll just have to wait until An Younggil publishes his complete commentary...
item.content:encoded: Guess we’ll just have to wait until An Younggil publishes his complete commentary…

item.title: By: Arthur Yeh
item.dc:creator: Arthur Yeh
item.description: I'm no pro but I think your theory seems sound. Seems like there's still some aji for the O18 group to work with. To me, it looks like the even bigger loss is if B gets L18, his H18 group suddenly looks a lot healthier (in sente too, because it threatens to connect to O18). Feels like W decided he cared more about the top side than the center at that moment, and didn't want B to just make eye shape so easily. An Younggil's commentary suggests that M14 would have been better though so maybe the center was actually bigger...
item.content:encoded:
I’m no pro but I think your theory seems sound. Seems like there’s still some aji for the O18 group to work with. To me, it looks like the even bigger loss is if B gets L18, his H18 group suddenly looks a lot healthier (in sente too, because it threatens to connect to O18). Feels like W decided he cared more about the top side than the center at that moment, and didn’t want B to just make eye shape so easily.
An Younggil’s commentary suggests that M14 would have been better though so maybe the center was actually bigger…
